conclusion: Analyze the given displacement-time graph to determine the number of moments when the speed is 5 m/s within the time interval from 0 to 4 seconds.
Identify the speed at different times: The speed is 5 m/s at t = 2 seconds and t = 4 seconds.
The displacement at t = 2 seconds is 10 m.
Determine the speed at t = 2 seconds using the formula v = x/t: v = 10 m / 2 s = 5 m/s.
The displacement at t = 4 seconds is 0 m.
Determine the speed at t = 4 seconds using the formula v = x/t: v = 0 m / 4 s = 0 m/s.
The graph shows that the particle's displacement decreases over time.
At t = 2 seconds, the particle is at a displacement of 10 m.
At t = 4 seconds, the particle is at a displacement of 0 m.
Identify the moments when the speed is 5 m/s: The speed is 5 m/s at t = 2 seconds and t = 4 seconds.
Since the speed is 5 m/s at both t = 2 seconds and t = 4 seconds, there are two moments when the speed is 5 m/s within the time interval from 0 to 4 seconds.
The final answer is two moments.
